meanings.definition: The act of revoking or annulling something.
meanings.sent1: The revocations of the permission slip caused confusion among the students.
meanings.sent2: The government's revocations of certain laws led to protests.
meanings.sent3: The revocations of the bedtime rule made the children very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her revocations of the friendship ended their relationship abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The revocations of the treaty were met with disbelief by the neighboring countries.

meanings.definition: The official cancellation of a decree, decision, or promise.
meanings.sent1: The company's revocations of the contract surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The revocations of the event due to bad weather disappointed many attendees.
meanings.sent3: The revocations of the dessert promise left the kids disappointed.
meanings.sent4: His revocations of the wedding plans shocked his fiancée.
meanings.sent5: The revocations of the award announcement caused confusion among the nominees.
